Î±-strongly convex and Î²-smooth

For scalar functions, a twice-differentiable function ff is Î±-strongly convex and Î²-smooth if for all xx, Î±â‰¤fâ€³(x)â‰¤Î²\alpha \leq f''(x) \leq \beta

If f is Î²-smooth and Î±-strongly convex then at any point ğ±\mathbf{x}, the Hessian âˆ‡2f(ğ±)âˆ‡^2 f(\mathbf{x}) satisfies: Î±ğˆâ‰¼âˆ‡2f(ğ±)â‰¼Î²ğˆ\alpha \mathbf{I} \preceq âˆ‡^2 f(\mathbf{x}) \preceq \beta \mathbf{I} where ğˆ\mathbf{I} is a dÃ—dd \times d identity matrix.
